purpose: Enables movement, maintains posture, and produces heat through three types of muscle tissue: skeletal, smooth, and cardiac.

interfaces.name: Musculoskeletal Integration
interfaces.description: Facilitates movement and posture by interacting with the skeletal system. Verified by anatomy and physiology literature.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (Gray's Anatomy, PubMed)

interfaces.name: Neural Control
interfaces.description: Receives motor commands from the nervous system to initiate movement. Verified by neurophysiology literature.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (NCBI, physiology textbooks)

interfaces.name: Cardiac Circulation
interfaces.description: Cardiac muscle forms the heart and pumps blood, interacting with the cardiovascular system.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (NCBI, PubMed)

verification_notes: Based on established anatomical and physiological sources.

justification.rationale: Standard anatomical model; all interfaces are well-documented in literature.
